qas.question: What caused Latin America's right-wing authorities to support coup o'etats?

answers.text: in the 1970s, leftists acquired a significant political influence

qas.question: Why did the Latin Americas Upper class support coup o'etats?

answers.text: to avoid what they perceived as a communist threat.

qas.question: The regimes in the southern cone collaborated in killing of who?
What did all countries restore in the 1990's
Where did the United States support dictatorships in the 1970"s?

context: In Latin America <a0_0>in the 1970s, leftists acquired a significant political influence<a0_0/> which prompted the right-wing, ecclesiastical authorities and a large portion of the individual country's upper class to support coup d'états <a1_0>to avoid what they perceived as a communist threat.<a1_0/> This was further fueled by Cuban and United States intervention which led to a political polarization. Most <a4_0>South American countries<a4_0/> were in some periods ruled by military dictatorships that were supported by the United States of America. In the 1970s, the regimes of the Southern Cone collaborated in Operation Condor killing many <a2_0>leftist dissidents<a2_0/>, including some urban guerrillas. However, by the early 1990s all countries had restored <a3_0>their democracies.
